(Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/Types/Round_ImpliedIrreversibleBlockHeight.cs] [Function: GetSortedImpliedIrreversibleBlockHeights()] [Return List Immutability] Should the returned list be immutable to prevent external modification? Could a malicious contract receive the list and modify it before it's used for LIB determination, corrupting consensus? (Medium)

(Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/Types/Round_ImpliedIrreversibleBlockHeight.cs] [Function: GetSortedImpliedIrreversibleBlockHeights()] [Long.MaxValue Edge Case] If a miner reports ImpliedIrreversibleBlockHeight = long.MaxValue, could this dominate the sorted list and prevent meaningful LIB selection, effectively stalling finalization? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/Types/Round_ImpliedIrreversibleBlockHeight.cs] [Property: MinersCountOfConsent] [Minimum Threshold] For RealTimeMinersInformation.Count = 3, does MinersCountOfConsent correctly compute to 3 (3*2/3+1 = 2+1 = 3), requiring all three miners? Is this overly restrictive or does it correctly implement 2/3 majority? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/Types/Round_ImpliedIrreversibleBlockHeight.cs] [Function: GetSortedImpliedIrreversibleBlockHeights()] [Select Projection] Could the Select(i => i.ImpliedIrreversibleBlockHeight) projection fail or throw if the property accessor itself has side effects or validation logic that rejects certain values?
